definitions.definition: To rove over, through, or about in a stealthy manner; especially, to search in, as for prey or booty .
examples: Watch the lioness prowling in the shrubbery for zebras.
It's easy to sneak vandalism into Wiktionary as there are few other users prowling the Recent Changes page.

definitions.definition: To idle ; to go about aimlessly .
examples: That dandy has nothing better to do than prowl around town all day in his pinstripe suit.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To rove over, through, or about in a stealthy manner; especially, to search in, as for prey or booty .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To idle ; to go about aimlessly .
( transitive , obsolete ) To collect by plunder .
